alert.note: Alert for Lawrence (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 19 at 12:59PM CDT until May 19 at 1:15PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM CDT FOR CENTRAL LAWRENCE COUNTY... At 1259 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Mount Vernon, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Mount Vernon... Miller... Stotts City... Halltown... Hoberg... Chesapeake... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 36 and 58. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for southwestern Missouri. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
